  17. (* Low-level communication with the debuggee *)

  19. open Int64ops
  20. open Primitives

  22. (* The current connection with the debuggee *)

  24. ‌let conn = ref Primitives.std_io

  26. (* Set which process the debugger follows on fork. *)

  28. ‌type follow_fork_mode =
  29.     Fork_child
  30.   | Fork_parent

  32. ‌let fork_mode = ref Fork_parent

  34. ‌let update_follow_fork_mode () =
  35.   let a = match !fork_mode with Fork_child -> 0 | Fork_parent -> 1 in
  36.   output_char !conn.io_out 'K';
  37.   output_binary_int !conn.io_out a

  39. (* Set the current connection, and update the fork mode in case it has
  40. * changed. *)

  42. ‌let set_current_connection io_chan =
  43.   conn := io_chan;
  44.   update_follow_fork_mode ()

  46. (* Modify the program code *)

  48. ‌type pc =
  49.   { frag : int;
  50.     pos : int; }

  52. module Sp = struct

  54.   (* Position in the debuggee's stack. *)
  55. ‌  type t = {
  56.     block : int;
  57.     offset : int;
  58.   }

  60. ‌  let null = { block = -1; offset = -1}

  62. ‌  let base sp n = {sp with offset = sp.offset - n}

  64. ‌  let compare sp1 sp2 =
  65.     match Stdlib.compare sp1.block sp2.block with
  66.     | 0 -> Stdlib.compare sp1.offset sp2.offset
  67.     | x -> x

  69. end

  71. (* Identifier of the code fragment for the main program.
  72.    Numbering starts at 1 and the runtime registers 2 fragments before
  73.    the main program: one for uncaught exceptions and one for callbacks.
  74. *)
  75. ‌let main_frag = 3

  77. ‌let set_event {frag; pos} =
  78.   output_char !conn.io_out 'e';
  79.   output_binary_int !conn.io_out frag;
  80.   output_binary_int !conn.io_out pos

  82. ‌let set_breakpoint {frag; pos} =
  83.   output_char !conn.io_out 'B';
  84.   output_binary_int !conn.io_out frag;
  85.   output_binary_int !conn.io_out pos

  87. ‌let reset_instr {frag; pos} =
  88.   output_char !conn.io_out 'i';
  89.   output_binary_int !conn.io_out frag;
  90.   output_binary_int !conn.io_out pos

  92. (* Basic commands for flow control *)

  94. ‌type execution_summary =
  95.     Event
  96.   | Breakpoint
  97.   | Exited
  98.   | Trap_barrier
  99.   | Uncaught_exc
  100.   | Debug_info of Instruct.debug_event list array
  101.   | Code_loaded of int
  102.   | Code_unloaded of int

  104. ‌type report = {
  105.   rep_type : execution_summary;
  106.   rep_event_count : int64;
  107.   rep_stack_pointer : Sp.t;
  108.   rep_program_pointer : pc
  109. }

  111. ‌type checkpoint_report =
  112.     Checkpoint_done of int
  113.   | Checkpoint_failed

  115. (* Run the debuggee for N events *)

  117. ‌let do_go_smallint n =
  118.   output_char !conn.io_out 'g';
  119.   output_binary_int !conn.io_out n;
  120.   flush !conn.io_out;
  121.   Input_handling.execute_with_other_controller
  122.     Input_handling.exit_main_loop
  123.     !conn
  124.     (function () ->
  125.        Input_handling.main_loop ();
  126.        let summary =
  127.          match input_char !conn.io_in with
  128.            'e' -> Event
  129.          | 'b' -> Breakpoint
  130.          | 'x' -> Exited
  131.          | 's' -> Trap_barrier
  132.          | 'u' -> Uncaught_exc
  133.          | 'D' -> Debug_info (input_value !conn.io_in :
  134.                                 Instruct.debug_event list array)
  135.          | 'L' -> Code_loaded (input_binary_int !conn.io_in)
  136.          | 'U' -> Code_unloaded (input_binary_int !conn.io_in)
  137.          |  c  -> Misc.fatal_error (Printf.sprintf "Debugcom.do_go %c" c)
  138.        in
  139.        let event_counter = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  140.        let block = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  141.        let offset = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  142.        let frag = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  143.        let pos = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  144.        { rep_type = summary;
  145.          rep_event_count = Int64.of_int event_counter;
  146.          rep_stack_pointer = Sp.{block; offset};
  147.          rep_program_pointer = {frag; pos} })

  149. let rec do_go n =
  150.   assert (n >= _0);
  151.   if n > max_small_int then
  152.     begin match do_go_smallint max_int with
  153.     | { rep_type = Event } ->
  154.       do_go (n -- max_small_int)
  155.     | report ->
  156.       { report with
  157.         rep_event_count = report.rep_event_count ++ (n -- max_small_int) }
  158.     end
  159.   else
  160.     do_go_smallint (Int64.to_int n)

  162. (* Perform a checkpoint *)

  164. ‌let do_checkpoint () =
  165.   match Sys.os_type with
  166.     "Win32" -> failwith "do_checkpoint"
  167.   | _ ->
  168.       output_char !conn.io_out 'c';
  169.       flush !conn.io_out;
  170.       let pid = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  171.       if pid = -1 then Checkpoint_failed else Checkpoint_done pid

  173. (* Kill the given process. *)
  174. ‌let stop chan =
  175.   try
  176.     output_char chan.io_out 's';
  177.     flush chan.io_out
  178.   with
  179.     Sys_error _ | End_of_file -> ()

  181. (* Ask a process to wait for its child which has been killed. *)
  182. (* (so as to eliminate zombies). *)
  183. ‌let wait_child chan =
  184.   try
  185.     output_char chan.io_out 'w'
  186.   with
  187.     Sys_error _ | End_of_file -> ()

  189. (* Move to initial frame (that of current function). *)
  190. (* Return stack position and current pc *)

  192. ‌let initial_frame () =
  193.   output_char !conn.io_out '0';
  194.   flush !conn.io_out;
  195.   let block = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  196.   let offset = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  197.   let frag = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  198.   let pos = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  199.   (Sp.{block; offset}, {frag; pos})

  201. ‌let set_initial_frame () =
  202.   ignore(initial_frame ())

  204. (* Move up one frame *)
  205. (* Return stack position and current pc.
  206.    If there's no frame above, return (-1, 0). *)

  208. ‌let up_frame stacksize =
  209.   output_char !conn.io_out 'U';
  210.   output_binary_int !conn.io_out stacksize;
  211.   flush !conn.io_out;
  212.   let block = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  213.   let offset = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  214.   let frag, pos =
  215.     if block = -1 then
  216.     begin
  217.       assert (offset = -1);
  218.       0, 0
  219.     end else begin
  220.       let frag = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  221.       let pos = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  222.       frag, pos
  223.     end
  224.   in
  225.   (Sp.{block; offset}, { frag; pos })

  227. (* Get and set the current frame position *)

  229. ‌let get_frame () =
  230.   output_char !conn.io_out 'f';
  231.   flush !conn.io_out;
  232.   let block = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  233.   let offset = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  234.   let frag = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  235.   let pos = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  236.   (Sp.{block; offset}, {frag; pos})

  238. ‌let set_frame stack_pos =
  239.   output_char !conn.io_out 'S';
  240.   output_binary_int !conn.io_out stack_pos.Sp.block;
  241.   output_binary_int !conn.io_out stack_pos.Sp.offset

  243. (* Set the trap barrier to given stack position. *)

  245. ‌let set_trap_barrier pos =
  246.   output_char !conn.io_out 'b';
  247.   output_binary_int !conn.io_out pos.Sp.block;
  248.   output_binary_int !conn.io_out pos.Sp.offset

  250. (* Handling of remote values *)

  252. ‌let value_size = if 1 lsl 31 = 0 then 4 else 8

  254. ‌let input_remote_value ic =
  255.   really_input_string ic value_size

  257. ‌let output_remote_value ic v =
  258.   output_substring ic v 0 value_size

  260. exception Marshalling_error

  262. module Remote_value =
  263.   struct
  264. ‌    type t = Remote of string | Local of Obj.t

  266. ‌    let repr x = Local (Obj.repr x)

  268. ‌    let obj = function
  269.     | Local obj -> Obj.obj obj
  270.     | Remote v ->
  271.         output_char !conn.io_out 'M';
  272.         output_remote_value !conn.io_out v;
  273.         flush !conn.io_out;
  274.         try
  275.           input_value !conn.io_in
  276.         with End_of_file | Failure _ ->
  277.           raise Marshalling_error

  279. ‌    let is_block = function
  280.     | Local obj -> Obj.is_block obj
  281.     | Remote v -> Obj.is_block (Array.unsafe_get (Obj.magic v : Obj.t array) 0)

  283. ‌    let tag obj =
  284.       if not (is_block obj) then Obj.int_tag
  285.       else match obj with
  286.       | Local obj -> Obj.tag obj
  287.       | Remote v ->
  288.           output_char !conn.io_out 'H';
  289.           output_remote_value !conn.io_out v;
  290.           flush !conn.io_out;
  291.           let header = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  292.           header land 0xFF

  294. ‌    let size = function
  295.     | Local obj -> Obj.size obj
  296.     | Remote v ->
  297.         output_char !conn.io_out 'H';
  298.         output_remote_value !conn.io_out v;
  299.         flush !conn.io_out;
  300.         let header = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  301.         if header land 0xFF = Obj.double_array_tag && Sys.word_size = 32
  302.         then header lsr 11
  303.         else header lsr 10

  305. ‌    let field v n =
  306.       match v with
  307.       | Local obj -> Local(Obj.field obj n)
  308.       | Remote v ->
  309.           output_char !conn.io_out 'F';
  310.           output_remote_value !conn.io_out v;
  311.           output_binary_int !conn.io_out n;
  312.           flush !conn.io_out;
  313.           if input_byte !conn.io_in = 0 then
  314.             Remote(input_remote_value !conn.io_in)
  315.           else begin
  316.             let buf = really_input_string !conn.io_in 8 in
  317.             let floatbuf = float n (* force allocation of a new float *) in
  318.             String.unsafe_blit buf 0 (Obj.magic floatbuf) 0 8;
  319.             Local(Obj.repr floatbuf)
  320.           end

  322.     let double_field v n =
  323.       match v with
  324.       | Local obj -> Obj.double_field obj n
  325.       | Remote v ->
  326.           output_char !conn.io_out 'F';
  327.           output_remote_value !conn.io_out v;
  328.           output_binary_int !conn.io_out n;
  329.           flush !conn.io_out;
  330.           if input_byte !conn.io_in = 0 then
  331.             raise Marshalling_error
  332.           else begin
  333.             let buf = really_input_string !conn.io_in 8 in
  334.             let floatbuf = float n (* force allocation of a new float *) in
  335.             String.unsafe_blit buf 0 (Obj.magic floatbuf) 0 8;
  336.             floatbuf
  337.           end

  339.     let double_array_tag = Obj.double_array_tag

  341. ‌    let of_int n =
  342.       Local(Obj.repr n)

  344. ‌    let local pos =
  345.       output_char !conn.io_out 'L';
  346.       output_binary_int !conn.io_out pos;
  347.       flush !conn.io_out;
  348.       Remote(input_remote_value !conn.io_in)

  350. ‌    let from_environment pos =
  351.       output_char !conn.io_out 'E';
  352.       output_binary_int !conn.io_out pos;
  353.       flush !conn.io_out;
  354.       Remote(input_remote_value !conn.io_in)

  356. ‌    let global pos =
  357.       output_char !conn.io_out 'G';
  358.       output_binary_int !conn.io_out pos;
  359.       flush !conn.io_out;
  360.       Remote(input_remote_value !conn.io_in)

  362. ‌    let accu () =
  363.       output_char !conn.io_out 'A';
  364.       flush !conn.io_out;
  365.       Remote(input_remote_value !conn.io_in)

  367. ‌    let closure_code = function
  368.     | Local _ -> assert false
  369.     | Remote v ->
  370.         output_char !conn.io_out 'C';
  371.         output_remote_value !conn.io_out v;
  372.         flush !conn.io_out;
  373.         let frag = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  374.         let pos = input_binary_int !conn.io_in in
  375.         {frag;pos}

  377. ‌    let same rv1 rv2 =
  378.       match (rv1, rv2) with
  379.         (Local obj1, Local obj2) -> obj1 == obj2
  380.       | (Remote v1, Remote v2) -> v1 = v2
  381.            (* string equality -> equality of remote pointers *)
  382.       | (_, _) -> false

  384. ‌    let pointer rv =
  385.       match rv with
  386.       | Remote v ->
  387.         let bytes = ref [] in
  388.         String.iter (fun c -> bytes := c :: !bytes) v;
  389.         let obytes = if Sys.big_endian then List.rev !bytes else !bytes in
  390. ‌        let to_hex c = Printf.sprintf "%02x" (Char.code c) in
  391.         String.concat "" (List.map to_hex obytes)
  392.       | Local _ -> ""

  394.   end
